[C.T.B.H. 46] (1890) C.H. 113
     353. Parents should make it their first object to become intelligent in regard to the proper manner of dealing with their children, that they may secure to them sound minds in sound bodies. The principles of temperance should be carried out in all the details of home life. Self-denial should be taught to children, and enforced upon them, so far as consistent, from babyhood. 
     [IRRITATING FOODS THAT CAUSE A THIRST WATER WILL NOT QUENCH-- 558]
